events.name: Docker, Kubernetes, and BigQuery on Google Cloud
events.description:
NOTE: this meetup is co-hosted with Google Developer Group NYC. Sign up to attend at the GDG-NYC Meetup event page; there will be no signups or wait list here.

https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/proxy/QSASPt3sSMZLOnABe3aLp2Mot8-t6KhRewQMxJGcZXJu9hkz8qCPirYf1h5724xu0i9QdpqGeMiMF5Y1GYCWLWtwTNt0u3xEKjbkLgaYfdsQP0liXBwc-qeD6yA1NPAsCILHu0Den6up_mA=s0-d-e1-ft#https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/spYDwLA_JYzaOhPdWxINhjw/image?w=624&h=1&rev=1&ac=1

Agenda

5:45 pm:

Doors Open

6:00pm:

FEATURE TALK: A Developers guide to Google Cloud Platform

SPEAKER: Ray Tsang, Google Developer Advocate (Google Cloud Team)

Abstract: There's a myth out there that says that developing applications for the Cloud is hard. What do you think? In this talk will introduce Google Cloud Platform and look at how Developers can get up and running quickly with Cloud development and then quickly go on to build solutions to solve even the most complex problems. We'll look at all of the Google Cloud Platform managed services that allow developers to focus on writing application code and we'll dive into how developers can utilize the full flexibility of VMs and containers when needed.

https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/proxy/QSASPt3sSMZLOnABe3aLp2Mot8-t6KhRewQMxJGcZXJu9hkz8qCPirYf1h5724xu0i9QdpqGeMiMF5Y1GYCWLWtwTNt0u3xEKjbkLgaYfdsQP0liXBwc-qeD6yA1NPAsCILHu0Den6up_mA=s0-d-e1-ft#https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/spYDwLA_JYzaOhPdWxINhjw/image?w=624&h=1&rev=1&ac=1

7:00pm

SHORT TALK: A Developer's Introduction to Big Query

SPEAKER: Ralph Yozzo (GDG New York Organizer)

Abstract: How would you like a SQL server that is scalable, with no server installation, no maintenance, no user administration, and only pay for time that you use it and very high quotas so development is almost free.  Well, that's BigQuery.

Don't want to deal with OAuth2 etc. well you can combine BigQuery with Apps Script and let Apps Script act as your authentication engine.  And you can focus on your application instead of the infrastructure.

We will describe some real world examples of loading data from public information (source: government open data portals) into BigQuery and how to use it in an application.

https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/proxy/QSASPt3sSMZLOnABe3aLp2Mot8-t6KhRewQMxJGcZXJu9hkz8qCPirYf1h5724xu0i9QdpqGeMiMF5Y1GYCWLWtwTNt0u3xEKjbkLgaYfdsQP0liXBwc-qeD6yA1NPAsCILHu0Den6up_mA=s0-d-e1-ft#https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/spYDwLA_JYzaOhPdWxINhjw/image?w=624&h=1&rev=1&ac=1

7:15pm

FEATURE TALK: 'From Docker To Kubernetes: A Developer's Guide To Containers'

SPEAKER: Mandy Waite, Google Developer Advocate (Google Cloud Team)

Abstract: Everyone is talking about Containers, but mostly in the context of how they work and not why and when they are useful or how to apply them to your own often complex and unique Use Cases. We'll look at how Google Cloud Platform enables developers when it comes to building Cloud Native applications and we'll show how support for containers fits into the big picture and provide insight into the when, why and how of using them. We'll wrap up with a cool demo of the Kubernetes Container Scheduler.

8:15pm Q&A

8:30pm Doors Close

events.name: CP100: Google Cloud Platform Fundamentals
events.description:
Google and ROI Training would like to invite you to this free, hands-on LIVE class to help introduce you to Google's Cloud Platform.

Registration is available via our website.

Course Description

This 8 hour instructor-led class introduces participants to Google Cloud Platform products and services. Through a combination of instructor-led presentations, demonstrations, and hands-on labs, students learn the value of Google Cloud Platform and how to incorporate cloud-based solutions into business strategies.

Audience

This class is intended for:

• Systems Operations professionals, Solution Developers, and Solutions Architects using Google Cloud Platform to create or migrate applications and application environments

• Business leaders who are evaluating cloud solutions or are new to Google Cloud Platform

Language: English

Prerequisites

Before attending this course, participants should have:

• Basic proficiency with command-line tools

• Familiarity with one or more programming languages such as Java or Python

events.name: Big Data: How SunGard and Kensho process Petabytes of data
events.description:
Developers and organizations today are dealing with capturing, processing, storing, and analyzing exponentially growing amounts of data to extract meaningful insights and knowledge. With this explosion of data, and the need to properly handle it, developers and organizations are turning to the Google Cloud Platform to develop and deploy efficient and scalable big data analytics workflows.

Come hear about how key Google Cloud Platform technologies are enabling developers to harness and exploit big data, and hear from organizations who have successfully built powerful big data analytics workflows in the cloud


Speakers:

Carter Page, Technical Lead/Manager, Cloud Bigtable, Google

Bigtable was designed over a decade ago at Google to handle mind-bendingly large datasets.  It inspired many open source big data technologies, especially HBase.  In May, Google released its internal database as a cloud service, accessible through the HBase 1.0 API.  This talk will cover:

• How Google has continued to improve Bigtable over the years

• The journey to externalize Bigtable to the cloud for other companies to use

• Its similarities and differences from HBase


Neil Palmer, CTO, SunGard

SunGard is a bidder to build the Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), an SEC-mandated data repository that will hold every event that happens in the US equities and options markets. This means that every order, every trade, every route of an order between different organizations, every cancellation, every change to an order — essentially everything that happens after someone enters a trade on a computer screen or communicates an order to a broker on a phone to the fulfillment or termination of that order.

Neil Palmer and team will present an overview of their proposed CAT solution, built on top of GCP, that leverages Dataflow, BigTable & BigQuery to (so far!) process 6 billion FIX messages per hour. They’ll also talk about where they need to go next to scale up further in order to be able to process 25 billion events an hour and extract actionable information out of what will eventually be a 30 PB datastore.

Matt Taylor, CTO, Kensho

Matt will share some info about Kensho, about how it's disrupting and democratizing access to financial analysis, and about how they're looking to use GCP to help solve their hard problems.

Agenda

6:00 - 6:30 pm: Attendees Registration / Networking

6:30 - 7:00 pm: Carter Page - Cloud Bigtable: Google's database, exposed

7:00 - 7:45 pm: Neil Palmer, SunGard - Dataflow, BigTable and BigQuery

7:45 - 8:30 pm: Matt Neil, Kensho - Time Series Analysis with Dataflow

8:30 - 9:00 pm: Networking and Goodnight

events.name: First Kubernetes Meetup - Kubernetes Architecture and Use Cases
events.description:

events.name: DevFest 2015: Firebase  & Google Cloud Platform Hackathon
events.description:
VENUE

The event will be held at the Water Tower Cafe within Google NYC. The address is 111 8th Avenue. Please enter by the entrance near 16th Street and 8th Avenue (closer to Citibank). 

We will have registration set up here. Please aim to be here between 8:15 and 8:30am so we can get everyone registered and into the venue before the event kicks off at 8:45am.

The Google Developer Group is hosting a 3-chapter (New York, North Jersey, Hudson Valley) DevFest event with a focus on Firebase and Google Cloud Platform as the back-end technology, and your choice of front-end.

We will have information soon.

For now, please RSVP and get on the wait list for the event in the NYC Google Developer Group event page if you are interested in attending and NYC GDG will reach out to you to confirm your participation.

Since the event is open to 3 GDG chapters we will have only a limited number of seats per chapter and will have to select participants based on some criteria. We will have more information on selection process soon.

Your NYC Google Cloud Team!

events.name: Spinnaker: Smoother Deployments
events.description:
Spinnaker is an open source, multi-cloud continuous delivery platform for releasing software changes with high velocity and confidence. Continuous delivery in practice allows organizations to release software quickly and reliably. It integrates software build, test and release processes by automating workflows that push software changes forward.

Netflix open sourced Spinnaker in November, after close collaborative effort with Google, Pivotal and Microsoft. Come hear from the engineering team from Google - get an introduction to Spinnaker, talk about how continuous integration works in practice, and ask questions about implementation specifics.

Speakers:

Rick Buskens, Engineering Manager, Spinnaker, Google

Rick Buskens is an engineering manager in the Developer Infrastructure group at Google, where he and his team believe in providing a great developer experience for cloud platform users, and in leveraging and contributing to open source software to deliver on this experience.

Rick will discuss the motivations behind continuous delivery, assess current best practices and opportunities, and discuss how Spinnaker uniquely fills various limitations by walking through its constructs.


Drew Michel, Site Reliability Engineer, Spotify

Drew Michel is a Site Reliability Engineer at Spotify focusing on providing developers with a self-service platform for managing capacity on bare-metal and public clouds.

Dave Stenglein, SVP of Architecture, Kenzan

Dave Stenglein is SVP of Architecture and Engineering at Kenzan where he is focused on building cloud platform solutions for clients that consist of devops tooling combined with 12 factor apps. Dave is a technology professional (sysadmin, developer, devops) with over 20 years experience and is driven to produce systems with robust, scalable, and secure architectures. Kenzan has helped with Spinnaker focusing on bootstrapping and ease of use.

Matt Duftler, Technical Lead, Spinnaker, Google

Matt Duftler is a Senior Software Engineer in the Developer Infrastructure group at Google where he has been leading Google's efforts on Spinnaker since 2014. Matt also implemented the Google Cloud Platform plugin for Cloudera Director. Prior to Google, Matt spent many years at IBM Research working on topics ranging from Scripting and Component-Oriented Programming Languages, to Web Services, to Business Process Intelligence and workflow languages/engines.

Agenda:

5:30 - 6:00 pm: Attendees Registration / Networking

6:00 - 6:15 pm: Brittney Coulson - Google Cloud Platform Overview

6:15 - 6:45 pm: Rick Buskens - Spinnaker and Continuous Delivery

6:45 - 7:15pm: Drew Michel - Continuous Delivery and Spinnaker at Spotify

7:15 - 7:45pm: Dave Stenglein - Continuous Delivery best practices

7:45 - 8:30pm: Matt Duftler - Spinnaker demo

8:30 pm+: Q&A, Networking and Goodnight

Please visit http://spinnaker.io/ for more info on Spinnaker.

events.name: [Cross-Post] Google and Spotify Engineers on the Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
Cross posting a NYC Data Engineering Meetup. Please sign up at this URL:
http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Data-Engineering/events/231230368/

events.name: Three talks about Spinnaker (x-post Continuous Delivery: NYC)
events.description:
CD and Spinnaker, Tomas Lin, Senior Software Engineer, Netflix 

Hear from one of the Netflix engineers that built Spinnaker, (http://www.spinnaker.io) an open source, multi-cloud continuous delivery platform built by Netflix in partnership with Google, Microsoft, and others. With Spinnaker, you can easily automate complex delivery processes into repeatable pipelines that enable rapid deployments with confidence. We’ll talk about building continuous delivery pipelines for deploying and promoting code across cloud virtual machines and containers. 

Haylard, Lars Wander, Software Engineer, Google 

A quick walk-through and explanation of Spinnaker’s Halyardtool. We’ll demonstrate deploying a high-availability Spinnaker configured with multiple cloud providers, external CI systems, authentication, and monitoring. On top of that, we’ll demonstrate a zero-downtime upgrade of Spinnaker and some of the other operational help Halyard provides.

Spinnaker Case Study, Dave Stenglein, SVP Architecture and Engineer, Kenzan

Spinnaker offers a transformative way for organizations to implement delivery across the board. In this talk we'll look at how one organization implemented Spinnaker to streamline delivery and reduce operational overhead while implementing better test cycles.

This event is x-posted from https://www.meetup.com/ContinuousDeliveryNYC/events/240846747/
events.how_to_find_us: Enter on the 9th Ave/16th St side (next to Starbucks)

events.name: Unlock the power of Firebase with Cloud Functions
events.description:

events.name: [GDG NYC] 2017 Festive Meet & Eat
events.description:
• What we'll do
We're supporting GDG NYC in their tradition of ending the year with a Festive meetup. There won't be any "signature" talks. Rather the goal is to hear from members of the community ( sign up for a 5-minute talks) and just have festive treats, drinks and conversation as we wrap up the past year, and prep for the new one.

Wear your festive sweaters and cheerful clothes. Bring your best attitude & let's make some resolutions for a healthy, successful & happy 2018!

PS. We will supply drinks and snacks. If you have home-made treats (or store-bought ones) that you want to share, bring them with you. We'll have a table set up for everyone in the community to just leave things that we can all try out. (Please label the ingredients so we can ensure allergens are identified) - traditional festive treats or stories/artifacts that are unique to your culture or family are super appreciated!

Let's celebrate community in the truest sense.

• Important to know
Sign up here to attend: https://www.meetup.com/gdgnyc/events/234963800/
events.how_to_find_us: take stairs to or elevator immediately after the entrance door on right hand side

events.name: Training: Cloud Study Jam / Mobile Web Dev Certification
events.description:
We're co-hosting this study jam with GDG NY, https://www.meetup.com/gdgnyc Study Jams are community-run study groups for students on Google Developers content, on various product topics.

On this event you'll:
* Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
* Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
* Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
* Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud computing.

AGENDA:
=========
5:00pm: Doors Open
5:30pm: Cloud Study Jams / GCP Essentials
7:00pm: Mobile Site Certification / Requirements & Schedule
7:30pm: Cloud Study Jams / Advanced Topics
8:30pm: Doors Close

Requirements
==============
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook) and charger
Have a modern browser installed. (We recommend Firefox or Chrome).
Join GDG NY Slack (https://gdgny.herokuapp.com)

Cloud Study Jam
===================
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges. Registered attendees will get free access to Cloud Labs content (a $70+ value). Completion will require mandatory attendance at this "prep" session followed by 2-8 hours of self-study. GCP ESSENTIALS:
1. Creating a Virtual Machine
2. Provision Services with Cloud Launcher
3. Creating a Persistent Disk (Activity Tracking)

ADVANCED TOPICS:
1. Intro to Docker
2. Scientific Data Processing lab

Mobile Site Certification
==========================
Learn about key technologies like mobile speed, PWA, AMP and web payments that are critical to developing and deploying modern mobile web sites and apps. Review require materials (takes 3-4 hours). Then take a Google-provided certification exam (90 minutes, multiple choice) to validate your knowledge.

Successful completion of the exam gives you a professional accreditation from Google that shows you have proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. The credential will be listed on a Google Partners page and also provided as a printable certificate.

GDG NYC StudyJams Benefits
=============================
1. Content provided by Google Developers
2. Accreditation (badges) from Google for your professional profile
3. Community support that will ensure you get to the finish line
4. Early alerts (via Meetup, Slack) to relevant resources/promotions to level up further

• Important to know
An email will be sent out either from David Silva, or from "GDG Cloud NYC Mailing List" in the week prior to the event with additional details. Please white-list these email addresses so your Spam Filters don't suppress it. If possible, please join Slack (https://gdgny.herokuapp.com) ahead of time.

events.name: Datadog in the Morning: Building a culture of monitoring
events.description:
6:00 - Doors open
7:00 - Intros
7:05 - Talk by Ashely Miller: Building a culture of monitoring
8:00 - Networking and questions
8:30 - Doors close

Speaker:
Ashley Miller is the Director of Engineering at Datadog where she runs the web platform and dashboard/data viz teams. Before that she built data infrastructure at BuzzFeed, built (and rebuilt) systems at many startups in NYC. Loves working with growth stage companies.

Host:
Stack Overflow is the largest, most trusted online developer community for developers to learn, share their knowledge, and build their careers. More than 50 million professional and aspiring programmers visit Stack Overflow each month to help solve coding problems, develop new skills, and find job opportunities.

Founded in 2008, Stack Overflow partners with businesses to help them understand, hire, engage, and enable the world's developers. To learn more about Stack Overflow's business solutions - technical recruiting, advertising, market research, and enterprise knowledge sharing visit stackoverflowbusiness.com.

events.name: A (not too) gentle introduction to deep learning for NLP
events.description:
NLP is hard. Deep learning makes it less hard to do better than we ever did before. In this talk we'll cover the limitations of "classical" methods for common NLP tasks and explore how deep learning has overcome them. Finally, we'll look at some of the most mind blowing outputs from recent results and dive into how deep learning enabled them. This talk is aimed at a broad but technically comfortable crowed, no deep learning experience or heavy math required.

Tal Perry is founder of LightTag (http://lighttag.io/), a text annotation platform as well as a Google developer expert in machine learning. Previously, Tal was a data scientist at Citi focusing on NLP, and CTO of Superfly.

He holds a B.Sc. in mathematics from Tel Aviv university and lives in Berlin with two dogs, a cat and an amazing partner.

Infor, builds complete industry suites in the cloud and deploy software that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily with your existing systems. Over 90,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation. Infor deploys its cloud applications through Amazon Web Services and various open source software platforms.

And they're hiring http://www.hookandloopnyc.com/careers/ !

• Schedule:

6:30 - Doors open
7:00 - Intros
7:05 - Talk by Tal
8:30 - Doors close

• Important to know

The talk will be in the 8th floor, check in at the reception and say you're going to the 8th floor to a meetup for access.

events.name: Google Cloud Platform in a Practical Way
events.description:
• What we'll do
You are a developer with exciting ideas to launch online, and you want to be all set for success from the start? This session will introduce the Google Cloud Platform key components by replaying the past 8 years at SnapEngage on the Cloud Platform, adding components of the platform one by one to grow from an idea, to a feature and finally to a software as a service serving billions of queries every month. We will cover Google AppEngine, Google CloudStorage, Google BigQuery, Google Compute Engine, Google Cloud Functions and also mention some interesting non-Google developer products which complement the Cloud Platform.

We're having a smaller event, a conversation and beers with Jerome Mouton, the co-founder and CTO at SnapEngage, a customer engagement and live chat solution. He is also a lead for GDG Berlin and a Google Developer Expert for the Google Cloud Platform. He has been using the Google AppEngine Python since 2008, and AppEngine Java from early 2009.

• What to bring

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: Check in at the ipad in the lobby with an id and picture. Find David Silva in the host list and come up to the 18th floor. If the door is not open send us a private message or text me and I'll come out.

events.name: Mind-controlling the Web with Brain-Computer Interfaces
events.description:
• What we'll do
What comes after the keyboard and the mouse? More advanced interfaces that allow more effective communication between human and machines, specifically those that tap into the brain. So, let's plug in the human brain to the browser and build a better web.

The human body is an ocean of electricity. Billions of neurons are constantly engaging as our thoughts go from one state to the next. Come see how we can tap into this data generated by human cells in JavaScript, and how to get started in the NeuroTech community.

Schedule:
6:00 - Doors open
6:40 - Intros
6:45 - Speaker
7:30 - Networking and beers
8:00 - Doors close

Bio

Alex Castillo is a Developer Expert at Google for Web Technologies. He is very passionate about the human brain and how we can use technology to understand it better. Alex has contributed to the open source community and focuses on Angular, React and NeuroTech. In his spare time, he likes experimenting with guitars and IoT.

• What to bring
Bring a photo id to get access to the building

• Important to know

events.name: The Rise of the Distributed Database
events.description:
With the advent of distributed systems with such as Docker and Kubernetes, it was truly only a matter of time before our data solutions obtained the same structural needs. This talk will take a look at the history of databases, from relational databases like PostGres, to NoSQL solutions, to sharding, and truly distributed databases like CrateDB.

With each step, this talk will highlight the advantages and disadvantages of each system with an eye toward security, sanity, and the future.

PJ Hagerty is Developer, writer, speaker, musician, and Developer Advocate, PJ is known to travel the world speaking about programming and the way people think and interact. He is also known for wearing hats.

Schedule:
6:00 - doors open, networking, food and drinks
7:00 - talk begins
8:00 - more networking and drinks
8:30 - doors close

Sponsors:

Crate.io data management software helps businesses put machine data to work. CrateDB & Crate Machine Data Platform process fire hoses of machine data with real-time analytics to improve operational efficiency and profitability. Crate distributed SQL technology makes Smart Systems & IoT platforms simpler and less costly to build, scale, and operate.

events.name: All Day DevOps, Streaming Live Online - October 17, 2018
events.description:
On October 17, 2018, we'll be participating in All Day DevOps, a live online, streaming event, featuring over 120 speakers from around the world talking about their experiences implementing DevOps and DevSecOps within their companies. All sessions are practitioner led. Our "No Vendor Pitches!" policy is strictly enforce.

https://www.alldaydevops.com/

Highlights include keynotes by Cindy Healy, who was on the team for the Mars Pathfinder mission, David Rensin, founder of Customer Reliability Engineering (CRE) at Google, and George Swan, Director of Engineering Solutions at Autodesk.

https://www.alldaydevops.com/addo-speakers

For those teams and companies who have 20 or more registrations, you'll receive a swag box with All Day DevOps t-shirts and other goodies as our way of saying "Thank you". Make sure your team registers with the same name so we can get an accurate count. (Register at AllDayDevOps.com to have access to up-to-date information on the speakers and sessions, and to get your swag.)

https://www.alldaydevops.com/club-20-all-day-devops

This is a free event. By registering for All Day DevOps, even if you can't attend, you'll have access to all of the recordings and slidedecks after the conference.

For complete information and free registration, join us at AllDayDevOps.com.
https://www.alldaydevops.com/

events.name: Android Dev Summit viewing party
events.description:
We invite you to the special & unique viewing parties ever!

Android Dev Summit is happening on November 7-8, 2018 in Computer History Museum. We wanted to make this special event more accessible and create a great experience for you.

Join the experience in a movie theater to watch livestream summit at the viewing party

We reserved your spot for the Android Dev Summit viewing parties in many cities and movie theaters. While you're watching the sessions live, you'll meet other developers and learn about the new Android updates. There will be food and a great atmosphere. Come and join the party.

Register for the one you'll be attending. Looking forward to seeing you there!

https://events.withgoogle.com/android-dev-summit-viewing-parties/

events.name: [ONLINE] DevFest On Air 2018
events.description:
We’re excited to announce the first official DevFest OnAir! DevFest OnAir is an online conference featuring sessions from DevFest events around the globe. These community-led developer sessions are hosted by GDG (Google Developer Groups) focused on community, networking and learning about Google technologies. With over 500 communities and DevFest events happening all over the world, DevFest OnAir brings this global experience online for the first time!

This is an online event, register here: https://devfest.withgoogle.com/events/devfestonair18#

events.name: GDG Cloud NYC: Holiday Mixer
events.description:
Join us for our end of year holiday party! Meet up with GDG Cloud NYC members and network with new friends while enjoying delish food and drinks.

During the event, we'll be taking the time to get your feedback on our 2018 speakers/topics and asking for your 2019 ideas!

Look forward to seeing you there :)
events.how_to_find_us: 9th Floor, We Work - 750 Lexington Ave, New York 10022

events.name: IWD NYC 2019 - Panel of Remarkable Women in Tech
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting an event for the 2019 International Women's Day. This event will highlight the remarkable stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs. Help us celebrate these brilliant women with an interactive panel where they will be speaking about experiences in tech!

About the Speakers:

Ale Paredes
Head of Engineering at Code Climate

Ale is the Head of Engineering at Code Climate where she helps engineering leaders with actionable metrics. With over 9 years of technical experience, she is passionate about growing an inclusive team and help foster an environment where everyone can grow their skills, do their best work, build resilient and scalable systems and deliver impactful solutions. Also, Ale is one of the founders of Latinas in Tech NYC.

Angela Medina
Product Designer at BuzzFeed

Angela has been designing digital experiences for over 10 years. Her past work in agencies, media and tech companies includes a wide variety of projects including contributing to successful digital experiences for Dodge and Fiat and leading the redesign of TechCrunch’s mobile applications. She now works as a Product Designer at BuzzFeed.

As a proud Colombian, Angela cares deeply about diversity and inclusion in Tech. She leads the Latinas in Tech NYC chapter. She’s also passionate about mental health, social good, education, mentoring aspiring designers, a waste free world, animals, traveling and good food.

Kaitlyn Barclay
CEO of Scout Lab

Kaitlyn is the CEO of Scout Lab, a creative agency at the intersection of brand and social. Scout Lab's clients include WordPress.com, Alibaba, adidas, Motorola, and they specialize in growing venture backed startups. She previously led global customer acquisition at Levi’s, after her start-up was acquired by ClassPass in 2015.

Nina Mehta
Design Manager at Mailchimp

Nina Mehta is a design manager at Mailchimp, a marketing platform for small businesses. She previously worked on teams in San Francisco and Berlin at Stripe, Pivotal Labs, and Twilio. Nina looks to take on work that absorbs complexity and put screens in the background. She's an almost certified expert in the Konmari Method and pair design enthusiast.

Joy Valerie
Digital Operations Strategist & Founder of Carrera Digital Solutions

Joy Valerie is a Digital Operations Strategist, Growth Hacker, Podcaster and Founder of Carrera Digital Solutions. A Rochester Institute of Technology alumni, Joy earned her Bachelors in International Studies & Engineering in 2013. Joy is passionate about leveraging technology and aims to empower founders and entrepreneurs to build scalable businesses all while traveling to 26+ countries.

Agenda:
5:30 - Doors open / Networking
6:45 - Intros and Welcome
6:50 - Panel
7:30 - Audience Q&A
8:00 - Closing Remarks
events.how_to_find_us: Entrance on 59th st. Go to We Work on Level 9. We will be in the main area. Please note photo ID is required to enter the building.

events.name: Reader Beware, Choose Your Own Scare... conversational UIs with Dialogflow
events.description:
Everyone loves a good spooky story! (Or is cowering under their bed sheets... Either/or...) And what better to captivate the audience than letting them choose their own scare? We all can't be in the same illustrious class of penmen as R.L. Stine, but we can create compelling experiences with tools such as Typeform! Code doesn't always tell a compelling story, but conversational UIs developer with easy to use logic jumps can help you craft your own interactive adventure. See how to use the Typeform to give your conversational UIs a voice on the Google Assistant with Dialogflow. Now you can spread your stories reach to more than 500 million devices, including smart speakers, phones, cars, TVs, headphones, watches, and more.

Speaker:
Michael is a Developer Advocate at Typeform as well as a lover of Angular, Firebase and Progressive Web Apps. Working with Angular since the early betas, Michael has introduced and worked with various companies in developing their applications with Angular or training them in best practices. Michael has also spoken at Angular meetups and conferences, including Angular NYC, Techduels, and the United Nations. Michael's dream side project is a MaaS (Memes as a Service) platform for meme delivery by mail.
events.how_to_find_us: Come to the 9th floor, we'll be in the main area

events.name: JS Coding Mentorship at Microsoft
events.description:
Join a community of other junior and intermediate developers seeking to improve their coding skills and fare better in interviews. During the Meetup, devs will be able to solve a sample coding project with the help of senior dev mentors and peers from the community.

[RSVP] **** RSVP is closed June 20 8AM EST. ****
Microsoft's building is very strict with security. RSVPing on Meetup does NOT qualify you for registering your spot at the event. If you do not fill out this form building security will not allow you to head to the event. If you are rejected at the security lobby because you did not RSVP, no one is responsible for your inability to check-in.

RSVP Closed, sign-up here for July 15th
https://www.codecorgi.co/summerseriesofcode

[RSVP] **** RSVP is closed June 20 8AM EST. ****

What's Upcoming? This Microsoft Meetup is GDG Cloud NYC kicking off our summer series of code workshops. Check back for future events. We are co-hosting a developer festival in September 2019.

TAKEAWAY: Participants will finish a coding challenge by the end of the session. This coding challenge can be used for your portfolio or a good example during your job interviews. Learn from lead mentors and your dev peers.

AGENDA:
6:00PM Laptop/dev environment set-up, food
6:30PM Welcome intros, coding challenge kick-off
7:00PM Lesson
7:30PM devs code, mentorship
8:00PM devs code, mentorship
8:30PM devs code, wrap-up
9:00PM EVENT CLOSED

LOCATION:
This is hosted in a small space at Microsoft. First 40 folks (at the event venue & on the official RSVP list) get a spot!

CHECKLIST:
- bring your laptop
- Github account, and basic git skills
- JavaScript proficiency

WHO SHOULD ATTEND:
- junior developers
- developers looking to switch jobs or careers

PARTNERS:
Codecorgi, Microsoft, Google Cloud
events.how_to_find_us: If you're locked out or can't get in DM me twitter.com/sydneylai
